oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Are Ligand-Stabilized Carboxylic Acid Derivatives with Ge=Te Bonds Isolable?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SIWATCH, RK
YADAV, D
MUKHERJEE, G
RAJARAMAN, G
NAGENDRAN, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: NATURAL RESONANCE THEORY
MOIETY E
COMPLEXES
GERMANIUM
CHEMISTRY
SE
GERMYLENE
CARBENES
ANALOGS
HALIDES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The stability of ligand-stabilized carboxylic acid derivatives (such as esters, amides, anhydrides, and acid halides) with terminal Ge=Te bonds is highly questionable as there is no report on such compounds. Nevertheless, we are able to isolate germatelluroester [LGe(Te)Ot-Bu] (4), germatelluroamide [LGe(Te)N(SiMe3)(2)] (5), and germatelluroacid anhydride [LGe(Te)OGe(Te)L] (6) complexes (L = aminotroponiminate (ATI)) as stable species. Consequently, the synthetic details, structural characterization, and UV-vis spectroscopic and theoretical studies on them are reported for the first time.
